snippet: A small step by the Syrian government to ease the plight of civilians in Homs is met with cautious optimism.
abstract: Syrian government agrees to provide humanitarian access to city of Homs, which has been under siege for over a year; news is met with cautious optimism by aid groups.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: A small step by the Syrian government to ease the plight of civilians in Homs is met with cautious optimism.

headline.main: Syrian City to Receive Aid, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Syrian City to Receive Aid, Officials Say

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
